Sentencas: A novel method of ceramic-to-metal joining, referred to as reactive air brazing, was investigated as a potential method of sealing planar solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Novel metal-ceramic joining for planar SOFCs

Sentencas: In the present study, yttria stabilized zirconia (YSZ) and Fecralloy were selected as subject materials to simulate the cell-to-frame seal in planar SOFC.
Titulo: Novel metal-ceramic joining for planar SOFCs

Sentencas: YSZ plates were joined with Fecralloy foils, using a range of CuO-Ag and CuO-Ag-TiO2 braze compositions.
Titulo: Novel metal-ceramic joining for planar SOFCs

Sentencas: Metallographic analysis revealed that a majority of the CuO in the braze preferentially migrates to the braze/Fecralloy interface, indicating a stronger affinity and interaction between the CuO and the alumina scale that had formed on the Fecralloy than with the YSZ substrate.
Titulo: Novel metal-ceramic joining for planar SOFCs

Sentencas: The addition of TiO2 to the braze had no significant effect on the microstructure or mechanical properties of the YSZ/Fecralloy joints, unlike what had been observed previously in YSZ/YSZ joining.
Titulo: Novel metal-ceramic joining for planar SOFCs

Sentencas: Four-point bend tests indicated that joint strength improves with increasing CuO content up to 8 mol % CuO, the maximum concentration of copper oxide tested, likely due to the concomitant improvement in braze wettability.
Titulo: Novel metal-ceramic joining for planar SOFCs

Sentencas: A maximum bend strength of 101 MPa was achieved using the 8 mol % CuO braze composition, demonstrating the feasibility of this joining technique for sealing planar SOFCs.
Titulo: Novel metal-ceramic joining for planar SOFCs
